meanings.definition: The ability to produce a desired or intended result.
meanings.sent1: The efficacy of the medicine in curing the illness was remarkable.
meanings.sent2: She doubted the efficacy of the new cleaning product.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand had such great efficacy that it even surprised him.
meanings.sent4: The efficacy of her leadership was like a magic spell, bringing success effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The efficacy of the sunscreen was so strong that not even a single sunburn occurred.

meanings.definition: The power to bring about a desired effect.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's efficacy in motivating students was inspiring.
meanings.sent2: The efficacy of the new law remains to be seen.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape seemed to have an extra dose of efficacy today.
meanings.sent4: His words had the efficacy of a powerful potion, changing minds instantly.
meanings.sent5: The efficacy of the vacuum cleaner amazed everyone with its cleaning power.

meanings.sent1: The efficacy of the team's strategy was evident in their victory.
meanings.sent2: She questioned the efficacy of the marketing campaign.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring had an unexpected efficacy in calming the child.
meanings.sent4: The efficacy of his argument cut through the confusion like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The efficacy of the plant fertilizer made the flowers bloom beautifully.
